info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rabun and south central Macon Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clayton, or over Black Rock Mountain State Park, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clayton, Mountain City, Tiger, Dillard, Sky Valley, Black Rock Mountain State Park and Scaly Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern Georgia...western North Carolina...and Upstate South Carolina.
